intro: Drimopogon parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved drimopogon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
